intro.description: These steps show you how to do object mapping using a running AUT.

item.title: Start the object mapping mode
item.description: Start the object mapping mode using the toolbar button.

item.title: Collect the first component
item.description: Hover over the top text field. It will have a green border

subitem.label: Check in the object mapping editor that this component (technical name) has been collected.

item.title: Collect the other components
item.description: In the AUT, collect the second text field in the same way.

subitem.label: Then collect the equals button and the result field.

item.title: Assign the technical names to the component names
item.description: In the object mapping editor, take your component name for the first text field (adder_value1_txf) and drag it onto the technical name for the first text field.

subitem.label: Repeat this process for the other component names. In this way, you tell GUIdancer which components to test in your specification.

item.title: Save the editor
item.description: Using the toolbar button, save the changes you have made in the object mapping editor.

item.title: Stop the object mapping mode
item.description: Stop the object mapping mode using the toolbar button.
